medical_history.chief_complaint: Clinical suspicion of Cushing's syndrome with symptoms of hypercortisolism.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reported irregular menstruation, central obesity, and hirsutism. Initially presented in May 2003, with urinary free cortisol levels significantly elevated. Symptoms temporarily improved after the first surgery but reappeared 6 months later.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history revealed hypertension, diet-resistant obesity, and polycystic ovarian syndrome for one patient. Not specified for the other.
